author: falconek67
title: Wonderful service
body:
I have had cause to use 111 many times because I get acute and painful UTI's. It is often impossible to contact my GP, especially at the moment and I have found the response from 111 to be very kind and compassionate.  
They listen and are friendly and do their very best to help. In fact they are often more helpful than my doctor. I just want to say what a wonderful service they offer. Thank you all on 111 for the work you do and please please stay as wonderful as you are.

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Communication with GP's is excellent.
body:
Everything on this ward has been fine, I feel as if all my needs are being met by the different members of staff and I’m being looked after really well. The staff are very caring on this ward and always show respect to myself and the other patients. The cleaners do a great job at keeping the ward at a high standards, I haven’t seen the facilities in a bad condition yet.  
The food has been nice it could be better but I don’t mind it as I’m not that fussy, but if I was I don’t think I would eat much of it. Communication with GP's is excellent.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: EdwinaRed
title: Positive birth experience
body:
I had the privilege of having my son's now aged 2.5 and 12 months in my home with the support of southern trust midwives. I felt so informed and supported in my choice to have my baby at home. I never once regretted my decision, even in the height of labour! Watching my children meeting their baby brother, minutes old, was a memory I'll cherish forever.  
Another huge advantage was hopping into my own shower and bed after giving birth, with the food of my choice, and some bucks fizz! Was also an amazing memory...but better than all of that, was the incredible care provided from the midwives who supported my during my two births. They were all so kind, empathetic and calming. Their presence was so reassuring, and they were so positive, despite being woken from their sleep in the middle of the night on both occasions!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: paprikagz94
title: Supportive and reassuring
body: Attended the Emergency Obstetric Unit in the Ulster yesterday due to reduced baby movement. Was looked after by Midwife Judith , who was just amazing! Judith took time to explain the process and include me in the decision making, whilst being really supportive and reassuring! I really, really appreciated it! I just wish I could ‘book’ her for my delivery now!!

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: NHSMCA22
title: Staff Rudeness.
body:
I phoned ward 14 RAH to be answered by what I found to be a rude member of staff. They sighed and said they had nothing more to tell me about my Mum and if there were any changes in a patient they would call.  
They were half way through the Meds and said they were short staffed and too busy to talk, and hung up the phone on me. The call only lasted 26 seconds. My Mum Is 79 and I think she has undiagnosed dementia. She was admitted with delirium and was diagnosed with COVID so wasn’t allowed visitors.

author: CJ94
title: Positive employment support
body:
[Very happy with 'Seeing the whole me']  
[Very happy with 'Staff attitude']  
I feel more positive about work and feel with Terri's support I'll be able to stay employed. She never judges me and is ready to listen and make me smile.

author: omegass97
title: My Long Covid Recovery
body:
I contracted Covid in December 2019. I was very unwell at the time with cough, fever, vomiting, diarrhoea, fatigue, decreased oxygen levels not to mention the headaches and loss of taste and smell. My family called for help on two occasions due to low sats rates. On the second occasion they came out to me but my sats just started improving at that stage so they left me stay home. The hospitals at this time were extremely busy.  
Luckily for me I started to turn a corner on day 11 and started to improve.  
However my cough went on for months and I had give courses of antibiotics. My headaches also lasted for a long time nearly a year. My breathing was very irregular.  
In March 2020 the GP referred me to the Long Covid clinic I think I got my first appointment in August. This was a life saver for me as they diagnosed me with long covid and referred me to the Occupational Therapist and to the Fatigue clinic. I felt i was not alone anymore and more importantly i was believed.  
Probably about September I had my first appointment with Carina my occupational therapist. She understood what I was saying and believed me about my fatigue and all the other problems I was having as a result of my immune system. She agreed I still wasn’t fit for work but came up with a plan that I could give to my employer when I was better.  
I was also referred to the Respiratory Physiotherapist and seen in October to March this year. My breathing pattern was very irregular and this was adding to my fatigue. After five months he taught me how to breath correctly and be aware of my breathing. During this time I also had very regular appointments with Evelyn in the Fatigue clinic. She was amazing and again believed in me. She taught me how to pace myself and to learn to know when I needed to stop to allow myself to recover. She was extremely patient with me and I felt better after each session knowing that I wasn’t just imagining this fatigue,  
All of these people put together were a God send. I think I would still be struggling much more now without each and everyone of them. I still need to stop and get very tired but they have taught me how to manage this. I am now working full time but from home. Soon I will be going back into the office starting with one day a week and slowly increasing

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

author: Julester
title: Positive experience at the Ulster hospital
body:
I was admitted in January 2022 for tests to find out what was wrong with me. I was in for 5 weeks got lots of examinations, ct scans etc , dozens of blood tests and a leg conduction tests which showed I had guillian barre syndrome. I was given 5 infusions of immunoglobulin and went home , saw the consultant and he said it was now c I d p , so had to go to ward 21 as a day patient for 5 more infusions of immunoglobulin.  
My treatment in both ward 5d and ward 21 was second to none. The nurse are so pleasant and full of fun , and very attentive it made my experience so much better

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Buzza
title: Affirmative service
body: I have been seeing the urology clinicians for a few years and all my visits including telephone appointments are very positive. They are thorough, affirming and very positive. How they write about you as well is also very affirming unlike another department describing body morphology as overweight

author: MsCT
title: It is the little things that count during a stressful time.
body:
I just wanted to thank a lady called Julia who took my call this morning.  
Last year I was referred to the South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust by my GP and more recently a number of weeks ago. This morning I rang to make an enquiry regarding my referral and spoke to a lovely lady called Julia in the outpatients appointment office.  
I just wanted to thank her for her patience, caring and helpful nature in handling my call. It made such a difference to me to ring and be listened too and not made to feel like I was being rushed or wasting anyones time.  
It is the little things that count during a stressful time waiting on an appointment.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Buzza
title: Unhappy about appointment changes
body:
I was referred on a 2 wk wait for suspected ca but a clinician changed it to an 18 wks telephone appointment despite my distressing symptoms getting worse. This was done when I asked if I could vary the particular time given for the 2 week wait.  
At a hospital appointment I felt I was being threatened with being passed on to another clinician because I dared to infer I could have been seen earlier.  
These attitudes made me feel that being seen and treated with courtesy was a favour

author: maymf89
title: Visit to clinic
body: All the doctors and nurses at Bishton Court came down from heaven to mop our brows and hold our hands as we venture in this wayward lifestyle. Without them there is no future they are all angels and I love them to bits

title: Good practice
body: It was very good and very helpful to talk face to face with the nurse she explained everything I needed to know

title: Five star and everyone working hard
body: Attended orthopaedic day surgery on 13 June. From admission to theatre and discharge I cannot fault all the staff I came into contact  with. Excellent efficient service throughout

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The people have been nothing but pleasant
body:
I am in with an ear problem. I got in here very quick and have got bloods, blood pressure and covid test done. I have to say it was quick and I am very surprised. The environment here is okay, it does the job as long as I het seen to and sorted. The level of care here has been very good so far.  
The staff are very good and so nice. The people have been nothing but pleasant, and they all look very busy.  
The only thing is, I do not know what is happening I am sitting here, I thought I would be going somewhere for my ear but have not heard anything.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Lovely place and workers
body: I was an inpatient for 28 days on section 2. Staff were lovely to me. I was well cared for at a time I needed it.

readBy.name: Cumbria, Northumberland, Tyne and Wear NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Practice:  brilliant care, amazing team
body:
Given the issues the NHS is facing with unbelievable demand for services, the team at Lawrence Hill - from administration to clinicians - are outstanding, proactive, caring and Lawrence Hill is the best practice with which I've been registered anywhere.

It is as simple as that.

title: Good practice
body: Had my first nurse consultation today which is a requirement of becoming a new patient with the practice. Very helpful and assisted in booking a follow up appointment with one of the doctors the same week. Very grateful to be at this practice after lots of issues at my last one

title: Supportive and Informative
body: Call back within hours of dropping off a sample. Patient service was excellent with informative and compassionate support from practitioner. Prescription send directly to the pharmacy. Excellent service

title: Friendly staff  and professional service
body:
I phoned late this afternoon to request a telephone consultation. Phone was answered fast. The receptionist,Lisa,was warm and friendly (as all the receptionists are whether  face to face or over the phone) and I spoke to my Dr within the hour.

 The receptionists are always helpful and often go out of their way to assist to be able to make your experience at the surgery run as smoothly and  stressfree as they possibly can. 

I rarely ring for an appointment but when I have previously my requests have always been met.

title: To the rescue!!
body: Just wanted to say huge thanks to the 2 members of staff that came to the rescue with a resident at Nightingale Court last week, came to help with their defibrillator prior to the ambulance arriving, as the warden at NC I cannot thank you enough. Reassurance and care even though the resident wasn't one of their patients. Huge, huge thanks

title: Best practice
body:
I'm patient of this surgery for a very long time I have found now staff very helpful and tries to manage to give appointments with drs if they can I would highly recommend this surgery for best drs nurse and staff yes there is times when its difficult to get appointments and hang on to phone for appointments for very long times.
 I find personally when I see drs I come out Happy because they listen to you and pay attention what you saying.im only saying with my personal experience.

title: Poor service is a health hazard
body: I work in the laboratory at RSCH, I test blood for GP surgeries in the west sussex and east sussex areas. I do 12.5 hour shifts, I have worked constantly throughout the pandemic. When I need medical attention I spend 30+ mins on the phone just to be hung up on or told they will phone me back but never do. I lost the hearing in my ear, which made phone calls difficult, the receptionist was unsympathetic and annoyed that I didnt want a telephone appointment (I cant hear???). I have not been seen or examined in 3 weeks, i have not heard anything from the surgery. So today I went to A+E because I'm in alot of pain and worried about being deaf at 26. It isn't an emergency, it doesn't require A+E, however unattended medical issues lead to emergencies. When will services improve? There is a clear issue in patient care that needs to be addressed, or are we going to wait somebody gets sued for medical negligence or somebody dies?

author: bravodq35
title: Lack of support or help for suicidal patients
body:
Best not saying anything as following suicide attempts and voices and hallucinations telling me to harm myself and gone to the extent of acting on them and bad depression I’ve received lack of support and majority of the times I’ve either contacted enhanced access myself or I’ve been brought in for assessment after being detained by police on numerous occasions over the last 3 years and turned away with next to no support.  
The minute the staff at unscheduled care read an eupd diagnosis they turn you away and to the extent of being told we don’t think you will act on your thoughts after an attempt.  
There has only been maybe 4/5 occasions over the last 3 years I have been taken seriously and actually offered decent help but apart from that the system is failing big time at the enhanced access.  
I’ve heard of many others that have been diagnosed with eupd being treated the exact same way and it’s appalling the way we get treated. I’ve lost all faith in the mental health system, community psychiatry is just as bad getting told if you take your own life we’re not going to stop you how is that helping anyone and refusing to relook at your diagnosis where is the duty of care when someone is clearly not in a sound place of mind?

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Fantastic surgery
body: Longlevens surgery is a fantastic doctors surgery for all the family. They go above and beyond to ensure needs are met, this is incredibly reassuring especially with young children. I would like to say thank you so much to all the team who make the surgery run so efficiently and ensure patients have the best care at the time they need it. Extremely impressed with this surgery. Thank you all.

title: Very helpful and caring staff
body:
The midwifes have been excellent.
Very helpful and caring.
We're first time parents and gave clear advise. 
The room was spotless. 
They did everything we asked. 

Thank you again ladies. 

Liam, Alex and Eleanor

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: They have seen me very quickly
body:
Accident and emergency has been okay, they have seen me very quickly. I am happy hopefully I can get in and out very quickly. The place is clean and tidy and it looks like everyone is listening to the covid rules with their masks, and staff using gloves and an apron, eases my worries that I won’t catch it here.  
The staff are so nice here, they always ask how you are. However, they are so overworked and so understaffed but that is the problem everywhere. You can tell they all love their jobs with the way they do it and the level of care we receive here is outstanding.  
It does not need any improvements.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Helpful staff
body:
The staff were very helpful and when the doctor phoned back I told him my symptoms then he said he wanted to see me the same day and he was able to fit me in that afternoon.
Excellent.

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Their attitude towards their job is very positive
body:
Accident and emergency has been fine, I was triaged quickly. They are very efficient getting bloods and covid tests done. It is getting busy now so can see that I might be in for a bit of a wait. I do not mind waiting as I can understand how busy they are in there constantly having people coming and going. The level of care here is good.  
The staff are so nice they always make sure you are comfortable and you can tell they are trying their best to get everyone seen as soon as possible. Their attitudes towards their jobs are very positive, I am surprised since they never look bothered or annoyed. I am very happy here.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Ms Whitelock
title: Quick and courteous response
body:
The lady who answered the call was extremely polite and courteous and expressed her condolences.  
She helped me by gaining the information and telephoning me back almost immediately with the contact information I needed.

title: Caring stagf
body: I took my daughter for an app for a check of her implant as she was anxious about a side effect. The nurse she saw (who inserted the implant on her initial app) was so lovely and gentle with her. She reassured her and made her feel very happy. Thank yoi

title: Fantastic birth centre
body:
I could not have delivered my baby safely and without any pain relief if it wasn’t for the excellent midwife team (aka ‘The Dream Team’) and facilities in the birthing centre.

Professional and friendly including the student midwife who was present, and the post birth care was also really helpful especially for a first time mum. I was surprised to be given my own private room after I gave birth and both my delivery room and private room after were clean and in excellent condition. I felt safe and trusted the midwife team to help guide me through my delivery and then take care of me and my baby. 

Thank you so much to the whole midwife team at UCLH birthing centre, it was the best choice for me and my baby, and has had a lasting positive impact on my journey into becoming a mother.

I would highly recommend this birthing centre!

title: Fantastic support
body: I’ve been cared for by heamatology department for almost 2 years now. After having bad experience from another hospital I was anxious about being treated. I cannot fault any member of staff during my visits to heamatology dept. Doctors work in an open and honest way with patients and involve patients in decisions about treatment. Everyone is so kind, caring and make an effort to say hello and get know you. The staff made the unpleasant treatment of chemo bearable. Nothing was too much trouble, you feel the staff really care about patients and the atmosphere is happy despite the difficulties of cancer throws at them. Even more amazing is this treatment was done during a pandemic!! Staff rose to the challenge and hygiene was impeccable at all times in all sections of the day unit. Too many people are quick to complain and I am usually one but this department needs credit for the amazing job they do. Thank you so much and I know I’m in safe hands when I come for a check up.

title: Professional & Caring
body: Was seen late evening after an appointment was made by the 111 service.  Staff were skilled, approachable and efficient.  An excellent facility that is of real value to the community.

readBy.name: Lincolnshire Community Health Services NHS Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff were very helpful, and all brilliant.
body:
I was in accident and emergency Saturday and it had a brilliant level of care. I had to wait 5 hours but did not mind that.  
The staff there were very helpful, and they were all brilliant. The doctor and nurse that dealt with me were outstanding I have to say but I cannot remember their names. They were so helpful and they kept me in the loop of what was happening and what their plan was.  
I came into DAU today and the experience has been okay apart from the doctor in there I did not get their name but they were very rude and need to learn people skills. The level of care has not been great here since it is that doctor I have been interacting with.  
Not much can be improved here.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: A11 - exceptional care
body:
I have been on ward A11 for the last 13 days having come to Stepping Hill as an emergency. I am due to be discharged today with a good deal of ongoing support in place, all thanks to the dedication of the excellent staff on this ward.

I have been diagnosed with cancer during my stay here - while being treated following a heart attack  - and I can honestly say that the care and compassion I've received here has been outstanding. I really can't praise the staff enough for their dedication, hard work, and commitment to their patients. 

Thank you all so very much for your invaluable help during this distressing time. The NHS and its patients are incredibly lucky to have you all.

author: adzt
title: Infection Mixed-Bag!
body:
Arrived at A&E by ambulance brilliant service from the paramedics who got me in quickly and by the book.  
Once I arrive in A&E obs taken by nurse, given the markers I was displaying being standby resus for a serious infection, the nurses decided it was appropriate to put me out in the public corridor, no welfare check, not a single nurse came to check on me or give me an update or even ask if I needed water or pain relief. It was an absolute disgrace, dumped in the corridor on a chair and left. Those chairs are not designed to be sat on for 6 hours at a time, you wouldn't allow your admin staff not to have ergonomic chairs, so why is it ok for your patients especially when your leaving them for hours? My body was so tired from the infection that I had to make a make shift bed on your chairs using my backpack.  
Finally at 02:30 in the morning after arriving at approximately 20:30/21:00, I got to see the doctor, and fortunately the story gets better. The doctors were fantastic and immediately got me sorted and got me onto some IV antibiotics and fluids.  
So at approx 07:00 I was moved into another part of the department where it was quiet for which I was thankful for.  
The consultant visited me at approx 08:00 and asked me what I wished to do regards further treatment as I was responding well to the antibiotics. They stated that I could stay in A&E, run another bag of antibiotics and fluids and then be discharge me home, or alternatively go up to the ward and spend a a bit more time with some more antibiotics etc.  
I elected for staying in A&E. A short while later, no more than 5 minutes or so, a porter arrived to take me up to the ward, I explained what I'd discussed with the consultant and the nurse then sent the porter away. Another 5 mins passed and another porter arrived and the decision had been made by whoever looks after beds in the dept that I should be going up the ward as there is a bed reserved for me up there. Fair enough I thought but why ask me in that case?  
So, I get up to ward B12 and the show continues. The bed that was reserved me didn't exist - they didn't have a bed for me and weren't expecting me. I was then popped by the window - again no welfare checks other than the receptionist who was lovely. No obs done, no offer of pain relief, I was left to my own devices between approx 09:00 and 12:00.  
I eventually approached a staff nurse and stated what the consultant had said about me just needing some IV drugs and then I can go home. I stated that if a bed is not possible please just treat me in the corridor but at least treat me and not ignore me just because there's no bed. I feel this is a basic failure in their duty of care, not to mention my dignity and mental health. Being left staring at a wall for 3 hours and ignored could be deemed a form of torture. I know that sounds dramatic and the standard reply of its not our intention etc but the fact is that this is what happened to me and at times that's how it made me feel. I would rather be at home in extreme pain but at least my family would acknowledge me unlike the staff did both in A&E and on ward.  
I now write this at 12:16 and I am finally in the room that has been made available for me which I am grateful for, but what a performance. I understand the NHS is under extreme pressure and I truly sympathise but when performance gets to this point, you've hit crisis point, close the doors and send them to another hospital. I can't provide feedback on the remainder of my stay but I think this is quite enough for you to review.  
Many thanks for reading!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Great staff but in crisis
body:
I don’t understand why there is such a shortage of GP’s nationally but it’s clear that this practice is in crisis. E consults are unavailable by 9 am Monday morning. Can’t reach you by phone. Don’t feel well enough to visit physically. If I call 111 they will say call GP. And vice Versa, as happened last week. All the staff and the GP’s are superb when you can reach them and have been great helping with my parents. Have you thought of grading patients according to their circumstances for example my father has ongoing health issues and at 86 really needs to be looked after by 1 or 2 specific GP’s who can then treat him better. I never see the GP twice anymore so they don’t understand my whole situation or else they have to take extra time to figure it out. 
Thank you for what you are able to do and I hope nationally something will be done as currently it’s impossible to get help and support when you need it.

author: Claire 1
title: Experienced staff who are brilliant at what they do
body:
I attend the medical day case unit every 6 months for an infusion treatment. The staff are always amazing, so pleasant, warm welcoming and friendly. They make what could be a very hard and difficult day, very relaxing and fun.  
I always have terrible trouble getting blood tests done because I have such difficult veins. Only last week I had 4 different nurses and doctors make 9 attempts before successfully getting enough blood to do the tests, I find that incredibly stressful and can feel very faint from it. Juvy couldn't find a good vein to start and very calmly went and got me a heat pack to improve the blood flow, came back in 10 mins once I'd heated up and got the cannula in first attempt. A completely stress free experience. This puts me at ease from the outset. This is the same every time at the medical day case unit, very experienced nurses who are brilliant at what they do and have such lovely and sincere patient care.  
Juvy, Diane and Danielle all tended to me during the day and were all lovely. I'm definitely missing some names but all the staff were brilliant. The guy who brings around the tea and coffee trolley is always really pleasant and has a bit of craic with everyone when he comes in too.  
If all areas of my care were like the service I get in medical day case, I would be a very happy girl.  
Thank you to all the staff

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Politeness doesn't cost anything.
body: I have had to visit the surgery twice in the last week and both times I have got into my car in tears just due to the rudeness of the receptionists.  Different reception staff both times. No eye contact, no greeting, not listening and generally just trying to get rid of you quick. Training of this side of their job needs to be looked at urgently.

title: Dispensary becoming so inefficient to be laughable
body:
As usual had to drive 10 mile round trip to pick up routine repeat prescription. Discover that normal 48 hrs wait has now turned into '4 clear working days' but how would one know? Nothing on NHS website says so. So no medication dispensed yet. Dispenser suggested date following week. 
If I had an illness requiring rapid treatment waiting four days could be serious. 
Why is the practice putting up with this? A bad dispensary is a reflection on the rest of the practice and just saying 'short of staff' is not an excuse.

author: rainps58
title: Excellent service and care
body: I arranged an appointment to have symptoms that were causing me considerable anxiety checked. All the staff - the receptionist and the three nurses who examined me - were so friendly, polite, professional and reassuring, they really put me at ease. Everything was clearly explained to me and they gave me absolute confidence that I was being well look after. It was excellent service and care!

title: Confused and even more depressed
body: After waiting 4 months finally got appointment. Practitioner didn't know why I had been referred or who had made the referral inspite of all the questionnaires I had filled in previously and which had obviously not been read. From the outset this didn't exactly make for a warm welcome. I was also asked what I wanted to do in the session which left me absolutely astonished because I thought that direction would come from the trained health professional. Bit like the doctor asking a patient what they d like to have a go at when they walk into the surgery !! I m afraid I m not an expert in mental health  and don't know how to fix myself which is why I signed up for therapy in the first place. If I knew how to fix myself I wouldn't be here. Practitioner said couldn't help even though I was obviously distressed and said would refer me to another department. Got back to me later and said I didn't fit the criteria so would refer me for screening and if the counselling department couldn't help I would be sent back to the original practitioner and they would then help me. Just another time and money wasting NHS shambles. I absolutely fail to understand (and it was not explained to me) why this first Practitioner couldn't help me first time round but would suddenly miraculously be able to help me if I went round the departmental loop first and was rejected. It's a shambles and I am even more depressed now than before the appointment which has left me high and dry. Meanwhile I continue to get no support for a long term health condition that affects my mental health and vastly reduces my ability to work. Cheers Dudley Talking Therapies - I had heard you were bad but this is a joke. P.S I would like to remain anonymous but notice I have to fill in my email - another joke cos now you know who I am and therefore my confidentiality has been compromised. Cheers again.

readBy.name: DUDLEY INTEGRATED HEALTH AND CARE NHS TRUST

title: Out of date contraceptive
body: Did e consult was then sent message to make app at sexual health clinic this took a considerable time on my phone to actually get an app. I find this not acceptable as I’m 66 years old and don’t really want to be at an sti clinic as this was fitted at my docters I would like sorted there.

author: Mightyjoe
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Encouraging rehabilitation service
body:
I have been on Whiteabbey Ward 1 since Friday, having been transferred from Ulster clinic. I have found it very interesting different staff, nurses, all do different jobs. The staff are good they have routines, they work double - the ratios of patients to nurses is quite large.  
I like to be in the open bay as you can see what is going on. I’m getting physio they're terrific, very encouraging. The food is adequate, warm, they do it very well.  
I’m here for 14 days for rehab I’m looking at it like a holiday. I wasn’t able to get out of bed till this morning but they got me out. A big fella Bob on night duty he got me washed and shaved it’s great. You couldn’t criticise anyone.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Dreadful surgery
body:
I am so frustrated and becoming increasingly angry with the practice at this surgery. It's impossible to see my GP and I'm struggling with 'online consults' where I have to speak to so many different people i.e. locum doctors, and pharmacists who neither know me nor my particular problems or my medications.

I find it extremely embarrassing having to discuss some intimate issues with complete strangers, and stressful when they can't find the information needed to make changes to my medication following blood tests.

Moreover, I'm angry that there will be no more face-to-face appointments and no one even bothered to inform me. I had to find out when I visited the surgery. Also at this visit, I asked for a dossette box for my many medications but was questioned publicly and loudly by a receptionist about my reason for the request. I'm already embarrassed that I'm disabled and unable to complete certain tasks like fine movement in my fingers whereby I have to fiddle around with medication blister packs and keep dropping the tablets.

The surgery has certainly gone downhill!

title: No help, awful communication
body: I had a appointment today a review after 5-7 years of being on depression medication. Walked in and they said it was a phone appointment. Nobody told me before hand. Planned my day around this appt. Which lasted 3 minutes. Absolutely unacceptable communication. Poor service. Felt like the person I saw just wanted to get rid of me due to the surgery closing soon. Pathetic. It’s hard enough asking for help. Especially when the staff do this.

title: hard to get through on the phone
body: ok, where do i start, love my 2 doctors, they are the best, but trying to get through on the phone is impossible at times, i have been phoning all afternoon, engaged then ringing then the phone gets cut off, or they say they cannot hear you, getting a appointment is impossible as you cannot get through at 8am or 2pm then when you do its oh sorry no appointments you have to call back, i understand its a very busy time, but to have the phone put down on you after being on hold for 40 minutes at a time this is unfair, all i needed was a few codes so i can do things on line for appointments and so on, now im back on the phone again in the morning, so upset my anxiety, panic attacts always get worse when i have to call,

author: Roadrunner1962
title: The staff are friendly and approachable and do everything they can to be helpful
body:
I want to share my experience of the outstanding services of the Pitlochry Community Care & Treatment Service (North).  
The nurses are friendly, efficient, informed and kind. The premises are immaculately clean. I am always taken on time. The nurses keep me informed about procedures and explain things to me. I always feel I am in safe hands.  
All the staff are friendly and approachable and do everything they can to be helpful  
I want to give special mention to the cleaner. The premises are kept immaculately clean. The floors are spotless and so are the toilets. The cleanliness of the rooms makes it a pleasure to be there.

title: Appalling ADHD team
body:
Due to an admin error on their part, the ADHD assessment team unjustifiably dropped me from their service before ever once contacting me. I waited a year for this appointment after being referred and never once received a phone call, letter, or email from them. My GP told me they claim I did not respond to a text, which is why they dropped me. While it is wildly unprofessional to contact a new patient solely via text message, I certainly would have answered if I had received one - but they never texted me at all. I have called and emailed them to find out what happened and give them a chance to rectify their mistake before I make a formal complaint, but they have not returned my calls. This is absolutely shocking to me. I have never had my health treated so cavalierly by a medical team. Utterly heartbreaking and infuriating.
I do not like to leave poor reviews, as all humans make mistakes, but I feel they've left me with no choice. I just hope they realise what they've done and decide to do right by me.

author: violetwh64
title: Supportive EMDR therapy
body:
I am receiving EMDR therapy in Enniskillen from Fergal  
I have always struggled with my mental health after tragically losing my sister in a road traffic accident. I have suffered since the age of 13 with anxiety and depression and was then diagnosed with complex PTSD at the age of 21. I have tried medication, CBT and all different therapies. Nothing seemed to help! After losing my mum I then had a breakdown and was admitted to the Ross Thompson which helped me get back on my feet and through the discharge I was then seen at home.  
A lovely student nurse referred me to Fergal for EMDR therapy. After just one session with Fergal I started to feel better! I went in crying my eyes out and left him laughing! After 4 sessions with Fergal I am off all my medication for my mental health and with the use of EMDR I have actually been able to deal with the root cause of all my mental health issues! I think that EMDR should be more widely used and not as a last resort! If I had have had this therapy years ago I would not have suffered so much! Please try to make this therapy available to more people by training staff in it.  
Kind regards

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Poor service for making an appointment
body:
I did not visit the practice so the date is of reference as to when I've been trying to contact the practice.

It is becoming increasingly difficult to get an appointment.
I work full time my working day is 10 hours. I have tried for a full week to get an appointment, when I was unable to get through as there is no other way than to call to book one, I asked someone to drop my prescription off to ask for a repeat prescription.
I received a text after opening hours to state that a repeat prescription wasn't possible and that I had to make an appointment. I tried again at 8.30 and could bit get through, so I rang straight after finishing work and did manage to get through to the receptionist, to be advised that there is no other way to make an appointment and have to call back at 8.30 am which I did for over an hour again and couldn't get through. They did mention an appointment could be booked for 4 weeks time, but I'm not being disrespectful but why on earth should a patient have to wait that long!!
Most people like myself don't want to bother the Doctor, but I would like at least an online service where I can arrange and book appointments in this day and age.
After some serious consideration I have started some treatment (HRT) that was prescribed last year and kind of need to have my prescription before I run out, however it's not looking possible that I will be able to do this.

title: Lack of staff
body:
Completely dissatisfied 
My partner had an accident and couldn’t walk there was no drivers available to help.
I had to take matters in my own hands and pick her up myself in and take her to the hospital.
When we arrived we waited over four hours without getting seen so decided to go to another hospital and they got us in and out after 90 minutes.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

author: doradors37
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have been more than helpful
body:
I’ve been on Ward 1 at Whiteabbey since last Wednesday. I was in Antrim Area previously for surgery and came here for rehab. I can’t fault Whiteabbey Hospital at all. The staff have been more than helpful. Bob who works at night time is comical and good at what he does. All the staff are great but Bob sticks out.  
The food is good but sometimes I feel like it’s coming very often. I would like the opportunity to get my hair washed as I’ve been in hospital for a while now without having that done. I feel like I will go home with a very good feeling about Whiteabbey!

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: Telephone appointment.
body: I had a telephone appointment today that didn't happen. Sat by the phone 8hrs and nobody rang, not even to tell me why. I rang 18 times and nobody in the eye clinic answered. Feeling angry.

title: Brilliant staff
body:
Visited 14th for a 20 week scan, this being our first time we were naturally anxious, even more so with past complications.

The experience from the moment of first interaction with staff through to the scan, was remarkable with everyone being so friendly and warming. The scan experience itself was outstanding, we were talked through every step of the way with reassurances where we needed them without us needing to ask.

For us, we could not have asked for more - the ladies that carried out the scan will not have known how much today meant to us as soon to be first time parents. 

A huge heart felt thank you!

title: Why have staff and patients stopped wearing masks?
body: I have a weakened immune system and I had to attend a appointment. I was shocked and appalled to see how many medical staff were not wearing masks! What is going on at Northwick Park? What are the staff doing to protect people like me? I always wear a FFP2 mask and up to now I felt safe at the hospital because most people wore masks, however, the majority of staff are not wearing masks. Please change this policy because I don’t want to get Covid. Shame on the staff who don’t consider patients like me.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: Worried daughter 123
title: The staff on the ward were nothing but amazing
body:
My mum was admitted to ward 14 following a recent illness. She is 71 , has dementia and is reaching end of life care. She normally is cared for in a care home . She is diabetic and her blood sugars were very high. She also became less responsive, vomiting and had diarrhoea. (She is a poor wee soul). The staff on the ward were nothing but amazing to both my mum and I. Nothing was a problem both when I visited and when I phoned .  
My mum can’t do anything for herself now requiring maximum assistance. My mum was spotlessly clean and as her condition allowed had been given drinks and food.  
Unfortunately some tough decisions had to be made for my mum and the consultant on the ward spent time with me on a few occasions explaining and comforting me when I got upset. He came to speak to me about my mum and lifted a glass of water in my mum's room and while chatting to me proceeded to give my mum sips of the water. Very touching.  
Sometimes people who have dementia get brushed to the side and forgotten. He took time to do this for my mum while talking to her and explain things to me.  
Unfortunately while my mum was in the ward I tested positive for covid 19. I was distraught as the decisions made meant that my mum is now for palliative care only so to then not to be able to visit her was terrible. The only way I could get updates was by phone. The staff on the phone were fantastic, understanding my circumstances.  
People are all too ready to complain when things are not to their liking. I just wanted to praise all the staff on ward 14 for their care of my mum and to me during a worrying, upsetting and sad time.  
You are amazing and keep doing what you are doing.  
Thank you

title: Cannot be worse
body:
First the reception. Her tone was really rude and with lack of empathy. Waiting times 30+ minutes just to get to the reception. 
They don’t allow you to see the doctor, only phone assessments. When I received the call in two days, the GP didn’t have the patience to explain who they are and they just hung up the phone, without any means for me to contact them back. I also have another bad experience, where my private doctor wanted to update my patient record, they wrote to them and the GP hasn’t bothered to update my medical record. Third world healthcare provider. Avoid

title: Very bad service
body: Call waiting is too long. Unable to take any appointment via patient access. If the call is getting connected , they will request for a call back. For vaccination of my kid , i directly went for an appointment , they told me to come next day. Again next day they told me come on another week . Local GP service is very very poor

author: Arctic Fos
title: Parking problems for outpatient appointment
body:
I took my 88 year old mother for an outpatient appointment at Hairmyres in June. The set down area was blocked by six cars, two of which had drivers in waiting...three patient transfer ambulances, two of which were empty.  
My mother, with understandable mobility issues due to her age, had difficulty getting out of my car and threading her way through all these "parked" (more appropriately abandoned) vehicles to access the hospital entrance.  
I had then to reverse to get out of the turning circle, as had two taxis and a minibus to allow me to get out.  
Surely this is captured on CCTV and the hospital can clear?

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

title: Cancellation of appointments
body: Arrived at Frimley Park Hospital today for appointment in eye clinic, my daughter had taken day off work to accompany me as per instruction in appointment letter only to be told appointment had been cancelled.  I was not notified of this prior to arriving at hospital.  There was no apology I was just told I was one of the unlucky ones, which would imply I was not the only one.  The cancellation of appointments and rescheduling happens very frequently at Frimley I am unsure as to why this is but all departments are prone to rescheduling however normally patients are at least informed beforehand.  My daughter is front line staff it is a shame she has had to waste a day of her leave and a shame for the service she was unavailable today

title: Absolutely disgraceful service
body: Visited the A&E with my son who was extremely unwell and we were booked by 111. Even so we waited 2 hours to see the triage nurse, then a further 1 hour to see another nurse only to be sent to register for a Dr and to be told by an extremely rude staff that our wait will be minimum of 8 hours! When asked if she is not even embarrassed to say that to patients, she plainly in my face, said no! And before I get an answer that A&E is not managed by the your trust, it is on your premises and the trust has handed the contract to these useless, ruthless people that are anything but caring and compassionate!Therefore stop hiding behind this excuse and review their performance and ask them to improve drastically or give the contract to somebody else! They do not care about the services they offer putting people lives at risk!

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

author: Larjag33
title: A calm, encouraging, supportive, safe and person-centred environment
body:
I had a short period as an inpatient at Roxburghe which was profound in helping me recover physically and mentally from two years of complicated health issues. So I was glad to be given a space in the day centre having recently completed my 12 week block- it has been a godsend.  
I am a young adult so I was slightly apprehensive about going into a group with mainly people who were older adults but this did not disadvantage me at all. Carol, Roxanne and especially Lee are such caring welcoming and knowledgeable nursing staff who checked in on my well-being and that of group members and kept things ticking on. They are solution focused and thinking how to help if anyone had been unwell or in pain, making quick links to other staff.  
As Covid eased it was also good to see other staff drop into sessions like OH and Physio who provided some stretching and advice. Each session started with a talk from a guest speaker on a range of topics e.g. pastoral care, writer, Nutritionist, pharmacist, physio etc and although I was familiar with many of these services each time I learnt something new or considered something different.  
This was followed by a relaxation session- Kerry is amazing- such a calm and considerate person thinking about the whole person and offering advice and tips to encourage relaxation out with sessions. Kerry led a half hour guided relaxation which always helped me relax and sometimes let out a wee snore.  
Actually I am hoping she does a podcast soon 😆 Kerry also gave me foot massages as an inpatient this additional layer of holistic care definitely aided my recovery.  
Then we have Donna and Niel the in-house artists. They made the group for me! I am not in anyway arty and actually scoffed at the idea on week one but with their support and encouragement I got into splatter painting and was delighted to leave with many pieces of art for myself and family and friends. Nothing was ever too much for Donna and Neil and they are so passionate about everyone having a creative flare and helping you find yours. Also just there general chit chat and listening to their knowledge of general arty things really left me upbeat as well as covered in paint.  
All in all the Roxburgh experience at day centre has been hugely positive for me in my mental, emotional and physical health although I have a terminal condition they have boosted my confidence in my new normal and found skills I didn’t even know I had. These relationships and being in the building and asking questions that might feel uncomfortable to other health staff in other settings has reassured me that if my health is to change or need assistance they are there and I can be confident in the care to expect as both an in and out patient  
It’s a pity that more people don’t know about the day centre particular those in a younger age bracket as I’m sure it could be filled multiple times over and each person would feel the benefits.  
Thanks to all involved in making the day centre what it is.. a calm, encouraging, supportive, safe and person centred environment for all

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Very Good
body: I was treated with courtesy and respect and very professionally when I went for my breast screening appointment in your mobile unit at Darlington Memorial Hospital today. Thank you.

title: So lucky to have this as our GP practice
body:
As part of my professional role I speak with people about their health and regularly  have to refer them to see their GP. I cannot believe the difficulty people have at accessing their surgeries to be seen or spoken to. 
Thankfully I have never experienced this at Dunchurch Surgery. They are very responsive, with no long waits to speak with a receptionist, and I have enjoyed the flexibility of have a phone call or a face to face meeting with my GP.  All of the staff have been more than helpful. 
I would like to say thank you to you all for the service you offer.

title: Neglecting older people and not  allowed to…
body: My 80 year old mother had a blood test cancelled that she had been waiting for for ages because the nurse was sick.  Whilst appreciative of staff  illness she now has to join the bottom if the list again and wait.  When she rang to speak to the practice manager apparently 'you are not allowed'.  Having been with this practice over 45 years this is disgraceful and ageist.  Reception staff should be more empathetic and compassionate, not disinterested and uncaring.

title: Lovely cleaning staff
body: I visited a relative on the 2nd of June I like to thank the cleaning lady that was there she was very polite and answered every question my relative asked and she was very professional I don't see many of those that often

title: Great nurses
body:
Had a hysteroscopy/biopsy two lovely nurses
Third nurse exceptional who did procedure I didn’t realise nurses did these procedures made me feel at ease where would Doctors be without these ladies big Thankyou marie x

title: Very good practice
body:
Had my appointment on a Saturday morning. Easy to park and within a short walk to the outpatient dept.
Staff very friendly and helpful. 
Consultant gynaecologist very informative
And reassuring.  Would be more than happy to repeat the consultation in Dorking hospital again.  Thank you to all staff.

title: Great department
body: Was referred to insomnia clinic for help sleeping which I had suffered with for a number of years. Had a few months of sleep therapy and the results have improved my sleep and overall daily life. The staff are friendly, really encouraging, supportive and knowledgeable.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Minors A & E Amazing service
body: We went to A & E with my daughter who had a damaged thumb.  I was hesitant about going due to the waiting times but on the way to the main A & E unit we saw the Minors unit and went there.   A far nicer place to wait than the main A & E, my daughter was in and out withing 1.5 hours.  Everything was done within the unit.  The staff and receptionists were great, my daughter felt comfortable to deal with the whole situation with me in the waiting  room.  There were 2 receptionists there when we were there, they both went out of their way to help with advice on what to do next to getting a wheel chair and helping someone inside.  The minors unit is a brilliant idea, saves people with minor injuries holding up treatment in the main unit and the service was amazing.  Thank you

title: A world apart!
body:
Recently moved from another practice and the difference is a world apart. 
The care and attention I’ve received since moving has been brilliant.
Health concerns I’ve had for years are finally being taken seriously and being treated.
So happy I moved and I really recommend this practice.
The longest I’ve ever been on hold is 5 minutes but usually it’s answered within the minute, my last practice id be lucky if I had my call answered at all. 
I’m really grateful to the doctors, nurses and reception staff for listening and being so helpful!

title: Incredible staff
body: I came in this past weekend for my procedure and I had been very nervous I the week building up to it. However, the midwives and staff there were incredible, they were so kind and they put my mind at ease the entire time. I felt comfortable and supported and the whole process was seamless. I was seen in good time and everything was explained to me and any questions I had I could ask. Thank you so much to all the wonderful staff, supporting me and all the other women who enter. You're angels on earth.

title: Poor service
body: Reported to A&E as recommend by walk in center with spinal pelvic trauma. After a few cursory questions was told to sit in the waiting room on a hard plastic seat and wait for doctor. After 3 half hours waiting a tanoy announcement said it is at least a 5 hour wait to see a doctor. I was in severe pain . There is no way you can talk to anyone and no one checks in your condition. Occasionally a face will appear from behind a door and shout the name of the next patient but that's all you see of staff.. as I was in so much pain I'm also epileptic and asthmatic I had to leave to go home to get my painkillers and other vital medication. Yes you read that right. I had to go home from A&E to get pain relief medication. The whole experience was worse than appalling it was sheer neglect of duty of care . If there was another hospital to visit I would but sadly there isn't.

title: Excellent service
body: Receptionist extremely empathetic and helpful. Really uplifted my spirits. GP gave me a phone consultation within 2 hours of calling and prescription sent to local pharmasist. Thankyou

title: Awful practice
body:
I am suffering with my mental health and finally at the age of 25 I decided to get help. I contacted my local GP (Hollymoor medical centre) i was speaking to them when the phone cut off. Instead of ringing me back they contacted my mom regarding my mental health which was embarrassing and was breaching data protection. They finally put me on antidepressants, very recently I have been trying to receive another batch of antidepressants as I have run out. Its getting close to a week of no medication. I have recorded my calls to prove that when I ring it cuts out or I get told "Ring tomorrow at 8am" what am I meant to do? 

I wonder how many individuals are in a much worse state of mind than me and what they would do if this was happening to them!.

title: Poor practice
body:
Waited 45 minutes after my appointment time even though I was first on the list. Felt I was being rushed to get through my appointment. 
Did not feel I was treated as a person, but someone who  was to be seen as quick as possible.

title: Fantastic practice
body: The staff are such wonderful caring I know we wait long time but they have a lot of patience there so caring more than I have ever seen so good at there job friendly and caring. I recommend here 100%

title: Poor telephone lines
body: I have been trying for almost 2 weeks now to get an appointment and no luck, the line never goes through and always cuts off. The only time I managed to get through is at 3.30pm 1 afternoon, only to be told there are no appointments left and to ring back at 8.30am. I even tried through the NHS app via an e-consult, only to be told to call back at 8.30am the next day for an appointment. I don't understand how anyone actually gets to see anyone at that practice, I can't even get onto the call queue. I've been reading the previous reviews and I do understand the practice is very busy and it is hoping to get a new phone system but I don't think that's the issue here.  The issue is only having on the day appointments, it would make sense to be able to book a few days in advance and to have slots available on the day for emergency appointments. Gaining a new phone system is an obvious point, but we have been told this will be happening for almost a year now and nothing has happened. I also saw on your website, you are accepting new patients - why advertise this when you are not able to see your current  number of patients ? In short, please change your current  appointments booking system because it is simply not working.

title: Absolute Professionals
body: Attended the Day Care Surgery Unit for removal of a Lesion on the hand. The reception, booking in process was so relaxed and professional and made me feel welcome and at ease. The team in the treatment room were amazing as was the Surgeon all working together with skill and a great sprinkling of humour. Cannot express enough how much a slightly daunting experience was made so reassuring. Thank You.

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great understanding
body: The practice listens to the patients and improves their service I would say - even daily! There’s plenty of reasons to not care - if patients are rude and lack understanding - but the practitioners carry on with their jobs and do everything they can to provide great service. Thank you!

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Brilliant on ward but a bit cold
body:
I was admitted to Daisy Hill Hospital’s Emergency Department with a kidney infection. I was treated very well in A&E and all the staff members were very good.  
After this I was transferred to the Female Medical Ward. It has been absolutely brilliant on the ward. Every staff member has been so so good. I would really like to mention both Joe and Sharon who have both been absolutely amazing to me. Staff attitude throughout my time on the ward has been very good.  
The only issue I have had would be that I was a bit too cold at night.  
Overall, my hospital stay has been good and I couldn’t say a bad word about anybody.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Tony01
title: Missed telephone consultation
body:
I received a letter advising me that I would be receiving a phone consultation the following morning - very short notice. I kept my phone with me all morning, but had put it down for 1 minute. I was called 20 minutes early & I missed the call. I was left a voice message saying that as I had not answered, they would reschedule an appointment. I rang the consultant's office & was told that the clinic was finished for the day. Obviously I was not going to be called at the arranged time.  
This system cannot work if staff are not willing to operate within the agreed time frames.

author: kilokk69
title: Regaining my independence
body:
When I first arrived here, I couldn't even get out of bed; I had to rely on the nurses to help me with the Sara Steady - with that, I was able to lift myself up a little and get out of bed. Eventually, I was able to push myself up to sit out of bed but my legs were still very uncoordinated.  
The therapists provided me with wheelchair to use to get around the place so I could be more independent. Realising I was able to go places e.g. the toilet by myself, I learnt how to do these daily things such as going to the toilet without needing any help. I picked up some things by myself such as locking the door behind me. After all, this is rehabilitation centre and the aim is for you to help yourself as much as possible and not for people to be helping you.  
Everyone is different but whatever you are able to do by yourself I would suggest doing it! When I first came here, I thought I would be wheelchair bound but by the end of my journey, I am able to walk safely with a frame and also able to carry out a lot of my daily tasks independently. Little by little, you notice changes that start to improve for example, my speech has become a lot clearer with thanks to myself and the help of Colin. Thank you to all the staff here!

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

author: crocodilejt76
title: Feeling suicidal
body: I would like pass my sincere thanks to Breathing Space, especially Margaret, who literally saved my life recently. I have a diagnosis of BPD but also experiencing menopausal symptoms, Margaret and the staff at the service helped me so much, her empathy, signposting, advice and excellent listening skills contributed to keeping me safe and getting the right help and support.

author: Decde74
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Brilliant staff keeping me updated
body:
I arrived here on Wednesday night at around 11:30pm via an ambulance. I was quite delirious, but my wife told me the ambulance arrived within 20 minutes. The paramedics on scene were able to get me stabilised and comfortable and were very professional. I spent around an hour in the emergency department before being moved to here.  
The staff here and in the emergency department are brilliant and I am getting good updates on my condition. The food is brilliant too and the variety on offer is excellent. I am very comfortable here and the facilities are great too, I have been using the showers every day and they are always clean and tidy.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Decde74
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff here are fantastic
body:
I arrived here on Saturday night at around 6:00 pm via the emergency department. I waited for around 11-12 hours before I was dealt with and brought up here at around 6:00am on Sunday morning.  
The staff here are fantastic and I am receiving good updates, they let me know as soon as they get the information. The food is great and there is a good variety on offer too. I am comfortable here and the facilities are great too.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: chassisqt95
title: A credit to her profession
body:
I recently attended A&E on a Sunday. I expected a long wait as it was quite busy but didn’t mind as I knew there were others needing more urgent medical care before myself. I was triaged, treated and sent home with a prescription all within 5 hours which to me was excellent considering how busy the place was.  
When I went through to minors it was extremely busy. One nurse in particular who sorted my IV drip (I believe her name was Laura, she is a newly qualified nurse according to her lanyard) was beyond amazing. She was so kind, calm and patient. I observed more than one patient be rude to her complaining about having to wait for a while and she very patiently reassured them, apologised and explained the waits. She was working under extreme pressure due to the volume of patients and is a credit to her profession. There was another female nurse too who was also lovely and helpful. And the dr who saw me was also great. I just wanted to give credit where it’s due, thank you!

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Very great practice
body: What an amazing team of doctors, they are, very efficient and very friendly doctors and administrative staffs, who are really willing to help their patients.

title: Exemplary service
body: My family have always been given the best care. We have been patients for 13 years and have found the care and attention to detail to be exemplary.  Referrals or any extra health care has been provided when needed. Appointments are thorough and unhurried and we are listened to.

author: Decde74
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: The staff here are brilliant
body:
I arrived here with my daughter last night via the emergency department. We were sent through to a doctor straight away and within half an hour were seen to by a paediatric doctor and brought here.  
The staff here are brilliant and are giving me good updates. The food is great, the staff have been very helpful in supporting both me and my daughter. We are comfortable here and the facilities are great

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: No Appointment
body: No appointment  doctors is amazing but the receptionist is so rude .You waiting  over 1 hrs and said is no appointment when you said  doctor said contact back when is not better then ignored doctor advised

author: Scottishgirl
title: Treated with compassion and respect
body: I was seen by a lovely nurse called Jane in sexual health at Hunters Health Centre in East Kilbride. I felt she really listened to me, explained the procedure well and I was treated with compassion and respect.

author: Visitor1955
title: Professional and helpful staff
body:
I accompanied my elderly father to an evening out-patient appointment and we experienced very helpful staff with a professional and friendly attitude who were also keen to help resolve problems.  
Both nurses and consultant were kind and reassuring.  
Thank you.

readBy.name: Norfolk and Norwich University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: They make it as homelike as possible
body:
Came to female medical after being in accident and emergency. Accident and emergency was okay they were very busy but that is to be expected. They done their best to make me comfortable. The level of care was okay I was happy.  
The staff there are very nice, they talk away to you and try their best.  
Female medical is so far so good, they make it has home like as possible. The level of care here is good they make sure to tell you everything that is going on. I am content, and happy with everything here.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have been so accommodating
body:
Female medical has been good, they are all so nice. The place is nice I cannot complain about it, we are not at a hotel. The environment is okay, the place is noisy but not too bad. The only thing is the lighting, the way you cannot do what you want and everyone’s is the same.  
The staff have been nothing but pleasant, they are so accommodating. They always are nice and never look frustrated which surprises me. By the looks of it they love their jobs and their standards are high.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Tine67
title: Thank you all so much
body:
My husband in his early 50's was admitted onto ward 5b cardiology as he was diagnosed with cardiomyopathy which was diagnosed very quickly. It was a shock to hear this as he has been fit and healthy before this.  
The consultant was fantastic and the staff nurses Aux staff right down to the care support staff day and night on that ward were fantastic. He got the best treatment and was there for over 5 weeks. It was a difficult time for us as a family during covid and only allowed one visit per week, which was understandable as everyone had to safe and as a care worker myself who worked through covid I know how hard visits were on families.  
I just want to thank everyone from A&E to the ward staff to the after care he received and his follow up appointments your all truly amazing and we appreciate everything that our NHS have done not only for us as a family but for everyone in general through the pandemic. I don't think yous are thanked or paid enough it's time for a big change for all NHS staff they deserve more credit and better pay in my opinion. Thank you all so much my husband is improving everyday and we are so thankful he is still here with us 👏👏

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: taurusxr75
title: Tying to get a letter
body:
I had a call from the chest clinic recently concerning my inhaler, they wanted me to go onto a different one. I was told I would receive a letter confirming this, but a week later and still no letter had arrived, so I went to the hospital to see if I could get a copy.  
After speaking to several people I spoke to a really nice person, her name was Pearl, she went and spoke to people. As I approached the chest clinic again Pearl was walking toward me, with a big smile she asked, not getting anywhere, I gave her my details and off she went, next time I saw her she had a copy of the letter and told me to give it to my doctors surgery, just need to say how good it was to get help from someone who didn’t seem to mind helping me out so felt needed to tell about it. Thank you.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: doodledandy
title: Community paediatrics
body:
It has taken almost two years for me to gather the courage to put this into writing.  
In mid 2020 I had a missed telephone appointment with a paeds doctor for my daughter, They made an assessment without speaking to me in relation to my daughter medical conditions and school attendance.  
I was disappointed with the outcome and was given a face to face appointment. When we arrived that day I let staff know immediately that my daughter had a rash which resembled chickenpox. We were then shown to the waiting area.. It is my understanding that a nurse made the doctor aware and my daughter and I continued sitting in the waiting room.  
After 20-30 minutes of waiting my daughter and I were lead to a clinician’s room. Within a few minutes, a staff member entered the room and they appeared extremely angry. They began shouting at me for bringing my daughter to an appointment with suspected chickenpox. I explained, I made staff aware at the first opportunity. The staff member continued to shout aggressively and made me feel incredibly vulnerable. I asked them not to shout at me, particularly in front of my then 10 year old daughter. At one point they mocked me and laughed when I tried to explain myself. I repeatedly asked not to be spoken to that way, especially when my daughter was there. I was deeply concerned about the impact this had on her. I could see how uncomfortable and worried she had become. We couldn’t get past the staff member to leave as we were inside the room and they were by the doorway.  
They ignored my requests and continued about the contagiousness of chickenpox and how harmful my actions were to staff. I then realised that they were not wearing a mask to protect us from COVID. I was told they would see a child with COVID before seeing a child with chickenpox. To this day, I remain shocked by this bold statement.  
I had no idea who this staff member was so I asked the nurse their name. I was informed my daughter wouldn’t be allowed to attend her appointment. I left the building shaking and crying to return to my car.  
We sat in the car whilst I tried ringing my husband to explain what had happened and ask for advice on what to do next. Whilst on the phone, I realised this staff member had followed us outside and was standing next to my car. I put down the window and explained my disgust at their behaviour and how inappropriate it had been. I couldn’t believe how I’d be spoken to by a healthcare professional.  
They continued to explain the seriousness of chickenpox and how children with terminal illnesses attend appointments in the building. I explained that they could have approached the situation in an entirely different way. We should have been kindly asked to leave the building and offered an appointment at a later date.  
I was then encouraged to attend the appointment without my daughter and offered for staff to check on my daughter whilst she sat in the car. The alternative option was for someone else to ring me and discuss via telephone. I decided on attending the appointment face-to-face, in hindsight I wish I had of asked for an alternative date to attend as my mind remained focused on how my daughter was feeling after this outburst.  
I found this appointment extremely difficult as I was shaking as a result of this person's behaviour. The Doctor I saw was very pleasant. I shared details of my daughters medial history and the main reasons for my daughters re-referral to the Education Authority. I specifically asked that a condition that was recorded on the medical report. I shared photographs of my daughters skin given that she had to wait in the car. It was important to me that the Education Authority and school were fully informed.  
Much to my disappointment, there was no reference of my daughters repeated diagnosis of this condition despite my request. The only reference regarding my daughters skin difficulties was general eczema with no explanation on the severity  
I believe my daughter was let down by community paediatrics as missing this diagnosis has led to additional stress.  
It was decided that a re-referral to community paediatrics for a face-to-face appointment would be the best way forward, considering the refusal to allow my daughters access to her appointment in late 2020. It was my hope that a new appointment would have given me the chance to talk about my daughters current medical history.  
I recently discovered my daughter wasn’t issued with a face-to-face appointment, however, another paediatrician has viewed her medical notes and decided that there is no additional information to add without any contact with myself or seeing my daughter.  
I cannot express the level of upset and frustration I have felt as a result of the community paediatric department since 2020. My daughter and I have been deeply affected by the behaviour of this staff member. I do acknowledge that they made contact with me the following day to apologise for their behaviour. My daughter has been left feeling even more ashamed of her skin problems and remains concerned that she may make others unwell when a new rash appears given this staff member's reaction.  
I have genuine concerns about speaking up due to any repercussions as a result of this care opinion and how it may affect my daughters care going forward.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
